comment: The equivalence classes under the finite separation equivalence relation are infinity balls. Thus, by ~ erdisj , infinity balls are either identical or disjoint, quite unlike the usual situation with Euclidean balls which admit many kinds of overlap. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Aug-2015.)
